text: Roger Eugene Ailes (May 15, 1940 - May 18, 2017)Lynda Lee Kaid and Christina Holtz-Bacha Encyclopedia of Political Communication Sage Publications Volume 1 page 21 was a Republican political operative. He worked for United States Presidents George H. W. Bush and Richard Nixon. He founded Fox News Network with Rupert Murdoch. He is the president of Fox News Channel. He was chairman of Fox Television Stations Group. Ailes became President of NBC's Cable News and Business Channel in 1993.Encyclopedia of Television edited by Horace Newcomb page 48 While working for NBC, he created a cable talk channel called America's Talking in 1994. That channel later became MSNBC. In 1996 he left to join News Corporation, owned by Rupert Murdoch, and launch News Corporation's Fox News Channel. He is Chief Executive Officer of Fox News Network. Ailes died at his Palm Beach, Florida on May 18, 2017 from subdural hematoma caused by a fall at the age of 77. ==References== Category:1940 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Deaths from subdural hematoma Category:Accidental deaths from falls in the United States Category:Fox News people Category:Republicans (United States) Category:Businesspeople from Ohio Category:Ohio University alumni
title: Roger Ailes
